description: Power-free kernel of 4th-power-free part of n.
comments: If n=Product[Pj^Ej] then a(n)=Product[Pj^Fj], where Fj=0 if Ej is 0 or a multiple of 4 and Fj=1 otherwiseMultiplicative with a(p^e) = p^(if 4|e, then 0, else 1). - Mitch Harris, Apr 19 2005.
example: a(64)=2 because 4th-power-free part of 64 is 4 and power-free kernel of 4 is 2.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jun 25 2000
